unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an awareness of some language and language use in both German and English.
Identify, describe and evaluate a few aspects of German-speaking cultures and societies.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of German at elementary level.
Develop elementary level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the German language.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: On-campus and external students revise the weekly content through the use of various self-study resources, practice and apply newly acquired structures and vocabulary, and engage with the relevant material provided on iLearn.

enrolment_rules.description: Not to count for credit for students who completed HSC German Extension or Continuers Band 4 and above

assessments.description: Students complete a timed online test of mixed type questions, including one essay style question.
On-campus and external students demonstrate active engagement with the weekly content through participating in the designated activities online and, where applicable, in class.
Students complete various short tests of mixed question types. These tests are scheduled during class time.
Students engage with a variety of low-stakes writing tasks in the target language.
Students conduct the required reading and answer the questions related to the readings.

Students are assessed in pairs and engage in a conversation in the target language. This assessment is scheduled during class time for on-campus students and via online video-conferencing applications for external students.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This introductory German unit is intended for students with little or no previous knowledge of German. It seeks to develop students' skills in reading, writing, comprehension and speaking. The book used in this unit follows a communicative approach, with additional material offered online. The unit includes material on general cultural aspects of life in Germany. It corresponds to the first level (A1) on the six-level scale of competence laid down in the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR).
data.title: I German Studies 1
